update.description:
During the process of getting the package into Ubuntu, debian made me change the names to the packages to fit better with the policy \(they have consider the package name as the name in project clause of the CMakeLists.txt\).

This PR handles the transition from installed packages to the new names. I will probably relase a ~pre version to check that we everything is fine.

FYI: @chapulina @caguero @scpeters
update.title: Migrate package names to sync with Ubuntu upstream

pullrequest.title: Migrate package names to sync with Ubuntu upstream

content.raw:
The tarball and cmake project name both have `_`: `ignition-fuel_tools*`, while the tag and debian package name have only `-`: `ignition-fuel-tools*`

I think this is an inconsistency we just have to live with
content.html:
The tarball and cmake project name both have _: ignition-fuel_tools*, while the tag and debian package name have only -: ignition-fuel-tools*

I think this is an inconsistency we just have to live with

update.description:
During the process of getting the package into Ubuntu, debian made me change the names to the packages to fit better with the policy \(they have consider the package name as the name in project clause of the CMakeLists.txt\).

This PR handles the transition from installed packages to the new names. I will probably relase a ~pre version to check that we everything is fine.

FYI: @chapulina @caguero @scpeters
update.title: Migrate package names to sync with Ubuntu upstream

pull_request.title: Migrate package names to sync with Ubuntu upstream

pullrequest.title: Migrate package names to sync with Ubuntu upstream

content.raw:
It is indeed. I think that I have now the thing working as it should. From a stable installation of fuel-tools, the upgrade process from prerelease would do the following:

    The following additional packages will be installed:
      libignition-fuel-tools libignition-fuel-tools1-1 libignition-fuel-tools1-dev
    The following NEW packages will be installed:
      libignition-fuel-tools1-1 libignition-fuel-tools1-dev
    The following packages will be upgraded:
      libignition-fuel-tools libignition-fuel-tools-dev
    2 upgraded, 2 newly installed, 0 to remove and 12 not upgraded.
    Need to get 120 kB of archives.
    After this operation, 76.8 kB of additional disk space will be used.
    Do you want to continue? [Y/n] 
    Get:1 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools-dev all 1.1.0-3~xenial [1,630 B]
    Get:2 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools all 1.1.0-3~xenial [1,618 B]
    Get:3 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools1-1 amd64 1.1.0-3~xenial [102 kB]
    Get:4 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools1-dev amd64 1.1.0-3~xenial [14.9 kB]
    ...
    Setting up libignition-fuel-tools1-1:amd64 (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...
    Setting up libignition-fuel-tools1-dev:amd64 (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...
    Setting up libignition-fuel-tools-dev (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...
    Setting up libignition-fuel-tools (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...

With this setup we are in sync with Ubuntu packages \(using the 1-1 naming\) and also support the -dev package name without versioning, that would bring the 1-dev with it.
content.html:
It is indeed. I think that I have now the thing working as it should. From a stable installation of fuel-tools, the upgrade process from prerelease would do the following:

The following additional packages will be installed:
  libignition-fuel-tools libignition-fuel-tools1-1 libignition-fuel-tools1-dev
The following NEW packages will be installed:
  libignition-fuel-tools1-1 libignition-fuel-tools1-dev
The following packages will be upgraded:
  libignition-fuel-tools libignition-fuel-tools-dev
2 upgraded, 2 newly installed, 0 to remove and 12 not upgraded.
Need to get 120 kB of archives.
After this operation, 76.8 kB of additional disk space will be used.
Do you want to continue? [Y/n] 
Get:1 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools-dev all 1.1.0-3~xenial [1,630 B]
Get:2 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools all 1.1.0-3~xenial [1,618 B]
Get:3 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools1-1 amd64 1.1.0-3~xenial [102 kB]
Get:4 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease xenial/main amd64 libignition-fuel-tools1-dev amd64 1.1.0-3~xenial [14.9 kB]
...
Setting up libignition-fuel-tools1-1:amd64 (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...
Setting up libignition-fuel-tools1-dev:amd64 (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...
Setting up libignition-fuel-tools-dev (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...
Setting up libignition-fuel-tools (1.1.0-3~xenial) ...

With this setup we are in sync with Ubuntu packages (using the 1-1 naming) and also support the -dev package name without versioning, that would bring the 1-dev with it.
